meanings.definition: a large motor vehicle carrying passengers by road, typically seating between eight and thirty people.
meanings.sent1: The omnibusses in the city are always full during rush hour.
meanings.sent2: I took the omnibusses to get to work this morning.
meanings.sent3: The omnibusses decided to have a race to see who could reach the bus stop first.
meanings.sent4: The line of omnibusses stretched for miles, like a colorful snake on the road.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the omnibusses rumbling down the street was deafening.

meanings.definition: to transport or convey by omnibus.
meanings.sent1: The company omnibusses passengers to and from the airport every day.
meanings.sent2: We omnibussed the tourists around the city to show them the sights.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to omnibusses their toys to the park for a picnic.
meanings.sent4: She omnibusses her thoughts from one topic to another, never staying focused.
meanings.sent5: The music omnibusses me back to my childhood, filling me with nostalgia.
